title: Wrong callback URL in documentation for GitHub OIDC
body:
### Describe the bug

The documentation on
 - https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-providers#github

specifically calls out the importance of configuring the github security tokens with the **right callback url** but then documents the wrong URL.

The docs state to use `_renarde/security/github-success` but apparently it should be `_renarde/security/oidc-success` instead.

### Expected behavior

Following the documentation should work.

### Actual behavior

Login fails with obscure 401 errors.

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer:
 - follow the documented instructions at https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-providers#github

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

6.10.3-sanne-os1

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "21.0.4" 2024-07-16

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.13.2

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.9.6 (bc0240f3c744dd6b6ec2920b3cd08dcc295161ae)

### Additional information

It would be really nice to also have a "how to debug things when they don't work" section in the OIDC guide, for example even just suggesting which log levels to set to get some more clues would have saved me a bunch of time.

Also, I think the documentation was correct in the past as it did work for me when I last tried this back in March. I suspect some dependency upgrade or a renarde code change caused this regression: could there be a way to have integration tests to cover such cases?
